p: On the essay of C. lunata conidia germination inhibition, it was verified that it had 100% of conidia germination on the positive control (methyl-thiophanate). The concentrations of 5.0 and 7.5 µL mL −1 of the C. citratus oil also totally inhibited the conidia germination ( Figure 3). Yet the concentrations 0.625; 1.25 and 2.5 µL mL −1 had a low inhibition percentage of 3.3%, 2.3%, and 25%, respectively, indicating oil activity upon the conidia, even in the lower concentrations.
